sub_topic: Show that every group of order 96 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C96, the alternating group A4 × C4 × C2, or one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 96. Determine whether G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C96 or the alternating group A4 × C4 × C2 or one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96. If G is isomorphic to one of these, provide a justification. If not, explain why G is not isomorphic to any of these groups.
message_2:
To determine whether G is isomorphic to one of these groups, we can use the Sylow theorems to analyze the possible structures of G.

The order of G is 96 = 2^5 * 3. According to the Sylow theorems, the number of Sylow 2-subgroups (n_2) and the number of Sylow 3-subgroups (n_3) must satisfy:

1. n_2 divides 3 and n_2 ≡ 1 (mod 2)
2. n_3 divides 2^5 and n_3 ≡ 1 (mod 3)

From these conditions, we have n_2 ∈ {1, 3} and n_3 ∈ {1, 4}.

Case 1: n_2 = 1 and n_3 = 1
In this case, G has a unique Sylow 2-subgroup and a unique Sylow 3-subgroup. Both of these subgroups are normal in G, and their intersection is trivial since their orders are coprime. Therefore, G is isomorphic to the direct product of its Sylow 2-subgroup and its Sylow 3-subgroup, which means G is isomorphic to C32 × C3 ≅ C96. This is the cyclic group of order 96.

Case 2: n_2 = 3 and n_3 = 4
In this case, G has three Sylow 2-subgroups and four Sylow 3-subgroups. It is not guaranteed that G is isomorphic to A4 × C4 × C2 or one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96, but it is possible. To determine if G is isomorphic to A4 × C4 × C2, we can analyze the structure of the Sylow subgroups and their actions on G.

If G has a normal Sylow 2-subgroup, say P, then G/P has order 3, and G/P is isomorphic to C3. In this case, G would be a semidirect product of P and C3. If the action of C3 on P is nontrivial, then G would be non-abelian. However, this structure does not match A4 × C4 × C2, so G cannot be isomorphic to A4 × C4 × C2 in this case.

If G does not have a normal Sylow 2-subgroup, then it is possible that G is isomorphic to one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96. However, without more information about the structure of G, we cannot determine which specific non-abelian group G is isomorphic to.

In conclusion, G can be isomorphic to the cyclic group C96, or it can be isomorphic to one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96. However, G cannot be isomorphic to A4 × C4 × C2 based on the Sylow theorems alone. To determine the specific isomorphism class of G, more information about the structure of G and its subgroups would be needed.
